resources.string: Using valid syntax in a way that is unexpected to the programmer is an example of what kind of error?
In some languages, variables have types. Which of the following are valid data types?
Name one boolean operator (excluding exclusive or (XOR)).
Which one of the following is not a valid comparison operator?

Logic errors result in unintended output or behavior.\nSyntax errors are errors that violate the syntax rules of the programming language.\nRuntime errors are errors that occur while the program is running.
Character (char) is a valid type, but characters can be stored using arrays or strings.\nInteger (int), boolean, and float are all valid data types in Java.

Boolean operators are used in boolean expressions which evaluate to true or false.
And will evaluate to true if all parts of the expression are true.
Or will evaluate to true if at least one part of the expression is true.
Not will make a true expression evaluate to false and vice versa.
>> is the bitwise right shift operator. Shifting bits has nothing to do with comparisons.
